Item.Line: Welcome to the world of Ensembler!
You will embark on a journey to become the greatest conductor and ensembler.
But before that, you will need to learn the basics of conducting in this world.
During a performance, you are expected to do 3 things.
The most important is trace: trace the flashing grey notes.
Good trace will increase your score, bad trace will decrease your score.
In the performance interface, you will see the following things: volume, score, and combo on top of the screen.
Volume can be increased by pressing "A", and decreased by pressing "Z"
Score shows how well you are doing in a level.
Consecutive correct moves will result in the score accumulating in an increasing rate.
Lastly, Combo shows the number of consecutive right moves you have done in the level.
Now, to the actual game play.
To conduct your ensemble, simply move your baton according to the notes that appear in the screen.
Trace your baton from the initial note to the note that appears next.
This is almost everything you need to know to play this game.
One last thing, notice the trail of stars that follow your baton?
It is also an indication on how well you are doing in the level.
While the score determines if you have passed a level, the trail of stars determines if you have failed a level.
Consecutive incorrect moves will result in decreasing the number of stars that follow your baton.
When the number of stars reaches zero, you will have to try the level again.
Alright, this is all you need to know about conducting in the world of Ensembler. Good luck and have fun!
